There are few businesses as glamorous as owning a bar or club. YouÃ¢â‚¬â„¢ll be the proprietor of the establishment where people meet, greet, eat and drink. ItÃ¢â‚¬â„¢ll be a home away from home for some of your customers, and youÃ¢â‚¬â„¢ll be the ruler of this social roost.

The profit potential for bars is incredible. By taking a $20 bottle of liquor, and selling it an ounce at a time for $1.50 and up, you can make as much as $192 per bottle. ThatÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s a whopping 800 percent return on your investment!

Owning your own bar or club can mean long hours, meticulous attention to detail, giving up vacations and weekends, and sometimes dealing with unruly customers. But if you have a clear vision, do your homework, and learn the ins and outs of the business, it can also translate into a rewarding and financially successful enterprise. If youÃ¢â‚¬â„¢re friendly, outgoing, like people and have good business sense, youÃ¢â‚¬â„¢re already well on your way.

Our step-by-step guide will help you turn your dream into a moneymaking reality. We cover the several types of bars you can openÃ¢â‚¬â€œneighborhood bar, sports bar, brewpub, wine or martini bar, and nightclubÃ¢â‚¬â€œand how to get those bar stools filled with happy customers. The author explains step by step everything you need to know before opening your doors. Topics covered include how to:

We share insider tips to increase your bottom line and make your venture a success. This easy-to-use guide also includes useful sample forms, cost-cutting ideas, common mistakes to avoid, and additional resources, plus step-by-step instructions, checklists, and work sheets that will guide you through every aspect of the start-up process.
